isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine Service, Model Year 1994 - 1998 - CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVES - Inspection - Cylinder Head Pressure Test

svcproc.title: Cylinder Head Pressure Test
svcproc.para: Pressure testing the cylinder head will reveal cracks in ports or sleeve leakage which cannot be observed using the dye penetrant method.

step1.para: Remove the valves. Refer to Valves, Removal for the procedure.

figure.caption: Installing the Fuel Injector Shoulder Bolts

step1.para: Install the inboard injector shoulder bolts into the cylinder head. Tighten the bolts to the special torque value

note.para: Be careful not to damage the fuel injector tips during this procedure.

step1.para: Install the fuel injectors into the cylinder head injector bores. Refer to Cylinder Head Assembly, Install Fuel Injectors for the procedure.

figure.caption: Installing the Cylinder Head Pressure Test Plate

step1.para: Remove the fitting or plug from the cylinder head. Install the pressure test regulator/gauge assembly.
Fasten the pressure plate and plate gasket to the cylinder head gasket surface with the mounting bolts and nuts supplied with the kit.
Spray a soapy water solution into all of the valve bores. Apply air pressure and adjust to 124-138 kPa (18-20 psi). Check for leaks at the following locations:

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, replace the cylinder head if leakage is observed at any port or at the upper or lower cylinder head deck.
